bibl.title: Albert B. Martin v. United States. Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2852
United States of America Western District of Washington } SS
The President of the United States of America, to Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, Greeting:

You ae hereby commanded to have the body of Arthur B. Martin, by you imprisoned and detained in the Detention Station, Seattle, Washington, in said County, State of Washington, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, before the Honorable Heremiah Neterer, Judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Court Room of the said Court, on the First say of SeptemberOct., 1914, at 2 o'clock, p.m. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Arthur B. Martin. And have you then and there this Writ.
Witness the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled Court this 24th day of September, 1914.
Attest my hand and seal of the said Court the day and year last above written.

figure.ab: Seal of the United States District Court Western District of Washington

div1.p: United States of America, Western District of Wash } ss:

I hereby certify that I served the annexed Writ of Habeas Corpus on the therein named Henry M White by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with JH Sargent his chief Deputy personally at Seattle in the said District on the 24th day of September, A.D. 1914
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Sep 25 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
